name: Maududi
text: Ha'. Mim.

name: Maududi
text: By the Clear Book;

name: Maududi
text: verily We have made it an Arabic Qur'an that you may understand.

name: Maududi
text: Indeed it is transcribed in the Original Book with Us; sublime and full of wisdom.

name: Maududi
text: Should We divert this Good Counsel from you because you are a people immersed in extravagance?

name: Maududi
text: How many a Prophet did We send to the earlier peoples!

name: Maududi
text: Yet never did a Prophet come to them but they mocked him.

name: Maududi
text: We utterly destroyed them although they were greater in might than these. The examples of ancient peoples have gone before.

name: Maududi
text: Yet if you were to ask them: “Who created the heavens and the earth?” they will certainly say: “The All-Mighty, the All-Knowing has created them.”

name: Maududi
text: He it is Who made this earth for you a cradle and made in it pathways for you that you may find the way to your destination;

name: Maududi
text: He Who sent down water from the sky in a determined measure, and thereby We revived a dead land: likewise will you be raised up (from the earth) --

name: Maududi
text: He Who created these pairs, all of them, and provided you ships and cattle on which you ride,

name: Maududi
text: so that when you are mounted upon them you may remember the bounty of your Lord, and say: “Glory be to Him Who has subjected this to Us whereas we did not have the strength to subdue it.

name: Maududi
text: It is to our Lord that we shall eventually return.”

name: Maududi
text: Yet they have made some of His servants a part of Him. Indeed man is most evidently thankless.

name: Maududi
text: Has Allah taken for Himself daughters out of those whom He creates and has chosen you to have sons?

name: Maududi
text: (They believe so although when) any of them is given tidings of the birth of a female child the like of which he assigns to the Merciful One, his countenance darkens and he is choked with grief.

name: Maududi
text: Do they assign to Allah one who grows up amidst ornaments and is not well-versed in the art of disputation?

name: Maududi
text: They claim that angels, who are Allah's chosen servants, are females. Did they witness how their body is constituted? Their testimony shall be written and they shall be called to account.

name: Maududi
text: They say: “Had the Merciful One so willed, we would never have worshipped these deities.” But they have no knowledge of the matter and are simply conjecturing.

name: Maududi
text: Or did We bestow upon them a Book before on whose authority they are holding on (to angel-worship)?

name: Maududi
text: Nay; they simply claim: “We found our forefathers on a way, and we continue to find guidance in their footsteps.”

name: Maududi
text: And thus it is: whenever We sent any warner to a city its affluent ones said: “We found our forefathers on a way and we continue to follow in their footsteps.”

name: Maududi
text: Each Prophet asked them: “Will you do so even if we were to show you a way better than the way of your forefathers?” They answered: “We disbelieve in the religion with which you have been sent.”

name: Maududi
text: Then We exacted retribution from them. So do consider the end of those who gave the lie (to the Prophets).

name: Maududi
text: Call to mind when Abraham said to his father and his people: “I totally disown all whom you serve

name: Maududi
text: except the One Who created me; and, behold, it is He Who will direct me to the Right Way.”

name: Maududi
text: And Abraham left behind this word to endure among his posterity so that they may return to it.

name: Maududi
text: (Even when they began worshipping others than Allah We did not destroy them) but bestowed sustenance on them and on their forefathers until there came to them the Truth and a Messenger who clearly expounded things to them.

name: Maududi
text: And when the Truth came to them they said: “This is just sorcery and we reject it.”

name: Maududi
text: They say: “Why was this Qur'an not sent down upon some great man from the two (main) cities?”

name: Maududi
text: Is it they who distribute the Mercy of your Lord? It is We Who have distributed their livelihood among them in the life of this world, and have raised some above others in rank that some of them may harness others to their service. Your Lord's Mercy is better than all the treasures that they hoard.

name: Maududi
text: Were it not that all mankind would become a single community (and follow the same way), We would have provided for all those who disbelieve in the Merciful One silver roofs for their houses, and (silver) stairs on which to go up,

name: Maududi
text: and (silver) doors to their houses, and couches (of silver) upon which they would recline;

name: Maududi
text: or that they be made of gold. Surely all this is only the enjoyment of the life of the world. But (true prosperity) in the Hereafter with Your Lord is only for the God-fearing.

name: Maududi
text: He who is negligent to remember the Merciful One, to him We assign a satan as his boon companion,

name: Maududi
text: and these satans hinder them from the Right Path, while he still reckons himself to be rightly-guided.

name: Maududi
text: But when he comes to Us, he will say (to his satan): “Would that there had been between me and you the distance as between the East and the West. How evil a companion you were!”

name: Maududi
text: (He will then be told): “Today it will not benefit you the least that after your wrong-doing you and your satans now share the chastisement.”

name: Maududi
text: Can you, (O Prophet), then make the deaf hear, or direct to the Right Way the blind or one lost in manifest error?

name: Maududi
text: We shall inflict retribution on them, whether We take you away from the world (before We do that),

name: Maududi
text: or make you see the end that We had promised them, for We have full power over them.

name: Maududi
text: So hold fast to what has been revealed to you. Surely you are on the Straight Way.

name: Maududi
text: Verily it is a great source of eminence for you and your people, and soon you will be called to account concerning that.

name: Maududi
text: Ask all Our Messengers whom We sent before you whether We had appointed any deities beside the Merciful One to be worshipped.

name: Maududi
text: Indeed We sent Moses with Our Signs to Pharaoh and his nobles. He told them: “I am a Messenger of the Lord of the Universe.”

name: Maududi
text: Yet when he brought forth Clear Signs from Us, then lo, they burst into laughter.

name: Maududi
text: Every Sign that We showed them was greater than its predecessor; and then We seized them with Our chastisement so that they may return (to the Right Way).

name: Maududi
text: (Whenever they faced an affliction) they would say: “O magician, pray for us to your Lord according to your station with Him. We shall certainly be guided to the Right Way.”

name: Maududi
text: But lo, each time We removed Our affliction from them, they would go back on their word.

name: Maududi
text: And Pharaoh proclaimed among his people: “My people, do I not have dominion over Egypt, and are these streams not flowing beneath me? Can't you see?

name: Maududi
text: Am I better or this contemptible man who is scarcely able to express himself?

name: Maududi
text: Why were bracelets of gold not bestowed upon him? Why did a retinue of angels not accompany him as attendants?”

name: Maududi
text: He incited his people to levity and they obeyed him. Surely they were an iniquitous people.

name: Maududi
text: So when they incurred Our wrath, We exacted retribution from them, and drowned them all,

name: Maududi
text: and made them a thing of the past and an example for those who would come after them.

name: Maududi
text: No sooner the example of the son of Mary was mentioned than, lo and behold, your people raised a clamour

name: Maududi
text: and said: “Who is better, our deities or he?” They said so only out of contentiousness. They are a disputatious people.

name: Maududi
text: He was no more than a servant (of Ours), one upon whom We bestowed Our favours and whom We made an example (of Our infinite power) for the Children of Israel.

name: Maududi
text: If We had so willed We could have made some of you into angels to become your successors on earth.

name: Maududi
text: Verily he [i.e., Jesus) is a portent of the Hour. So be in no doubt concerning it and follow Me. This is the Straight Way.

name: Maududi
text: Let not Satan hinder you (from believing in the Hour), for surely he is your open enemy.

name: Maududi
text: When Jesus came with Clear Signs and said: “I have brought wisdom to you that I may make plain to you some of the things you differ about. So fear Allah and follow me.

name: Maududi
text: Allah is my Lord and your Lord; therefore, serve Him. That is the Straight Way.”

name: Maududi
text: Then the factions fell apart among themselves. So woe to the wrong-doers from the chastisement of a grievous Day.

name: Maududi
text: Are they awaiting anything other than the Last Hour that it should suddenly come upon them without their even perceiving it?

name: Maududi
text: On that Day even bosom friends shall become enemies to one another, all except the God-fearing.

name: Maududi
text: (It will be said to them): “My servants, today you have nothing to fear or regret,

name: Maududi
text: you who believed in Our Signs and had surrendered yourselves (to Us)!

name: Maududi
text: Enter Paradise joyfully, both you and your spouses.”

name: Maududi
text: Platters and cups of gold shall be passed around them, and there shall be all that they might desire and all that their eyes might delight in. (They shall be told): “Herein shall you abide for ever.

name: Maududi
text: Such is the Paradise that you shall inherit by virtue of your good deeds in the life of the world.

name: Maududi
text: Herein you will have abundant fruits of which you will eat.”

name: Maududi
text: But the evil-doers shall abide in the torment of Hell.

name: Maududi
text: Never will their torment be lightened for them. They shall remain in utter despair.

name: Maududi
text: It is not We Who wronged them; rather, it is they who wronged themselves.

name: Maududi
text: They shall call out: “O Malik, let your Lord put an end to us.” He will reply: “You must stay on in it.

name: Maududi
text: We brought you the Truth; but to the truth most of you were averse.”

name: Maududi
text: Have they contrived some scheme? If so, We too will contrive a scheme.

name: Maududi
text: Or do they think that We do not hear their secret talks and their whispering counsels? Yes, indeed We do and Our messengers [i.e., angels) are with them, writing.

name: Maududi
text: Say: “If the Merciful One had a son, I would have been the first one to worship him.”

name: Maududi
text: Exalted be the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Throne, above what they attribute to Him.

name: Maududi
text: So leave them alone to indulge in their vanities and to frolic about until they encounter that Day of theirs against which they have been warned.

name: Maududi
text: He it is Who is God in the heavens and the earth. He is the Most Wise, the All-Knowing.

name: Maududi
text: Blessed is He Who has dominion over the heavens and the earth and all that is between them. With Him is the knowledge of the Hour; and to Him you shall all be sent back.

name: Maududi
text: Those whom they call upon, instead of Allah have no power of intercession, except such that testify to the truth based on knowledge.

name: Maududi
text: If you were to ask them: “Who created them?” they will surely say: “Allah.” Whence are they, then, being led astray?

name: Maududi
text: We call to witness the cry of the Messenger: “O Lord, these are a people not wont to believe!”

name: Maududi
text: Indulge them, (O Prophet), and say to them: “Peace to you.” For soon they shall come to know.
